overall_summary: The system initially starts and connects to Exchange servers successfully. However, there are recurring warnings and a critical error indicating network communication issues, specifically 'No data received,' which is preventing the application from properly listening to the Inbox folder for the account_id 'user_1'. This suggests external interference, most likely from antivirus or firewall software, compromising the system's ability to synchronize emails for that account.
priority_concerns: 2025-05-28 12:07:28.4152|WARN|85|660|129|Error in client close method: Trie to read a line. No data received. Please make sure that antivirus and fir wall software are disabled or configured correctly|

2025-05-28 12:17:31.8827|WARN|91|657|107|Error in client close method: Trie to read a line. No data received. Please make sure that antivirus and fir wall software are disabled or configured correctly|

2025-05-28 12:22:31.2588|ERROR|66|659|112|Error listening to folder. Folder: Inbox, account_id: user_1|"Limilabs.Client.ServerException: Tried to read a line. No data received. Please make sure that antivirus and firewall software are disabled or configured correctly. ---> System.Excepti=

identified_issues.title: Failure to Listen to Inbox Folder
identified_issues.details: The application is failing to listen to the Inbox folder for account_id 'user_1'. This is a critical issue as it means new emails for this account may not be received or processed, directly impacting core functionality. The error message explicitly points to 'No data received' and suggests antivirus/firewall interference.

identified_issues.title: Recurring Network Communication Warnings
identified_issues.details: There are repeated warnings about 'Error in client close method' due to 'No data received'. These warnings precede the critical error and indicate a persistent underlying network communication problem, likely caused by antivirus or firewall software blocking connections.

proposed_solutions.title: Investigate Antivirus/Firewall Software
steps: Check the settings of any installed antivirus or firewall software on the system.
Ensure that Mailbird.exe (or the application generating these logs) is explicitly allowed through the firewall.
Temporarily disable the antivirus/firewall software (if safe to do so in a controlled environment) to see if the errors cease. If they do, configure an exception for the application.
Review any network proxy settings or VPNs that might be interfering with the connection.

proposed_solutions.title: Verify Network Connectivity
steps: Ensure stable internet connectivity for the system.
Check if other network-dependent applications are functioning correctly.

question: Please analyze this log file and identify any critical issues, recommendations, and overall system health.
